if (parts.length == 2) return parts.pop().split(";").shift(); } // Get user token from cookies const userToken = getCookie('user_token'); if (subscribewithoutData === 'true' && userToken) { // Call the modal function with the category ID subscribed_popupmodal(subscribe_clicked_cat_id); // Remove the flag and category ID from localStorage localStorage.removeItem('subscribe_without_Login'); localStorage.removeItem('subscribe_clicked_id'); } }); /************************** update susbcriber content **************************** */ function initializeSubscriptionButton() { var initialListItems = document.querySelectorAll('.subscription-options input[type="checkbox"]'); initialListItems.forEach(function(item) { console.log(item.checked, 'Initial Checkbox checked status'); }); var listItems = document.querySelectorAll('.subscription-options li'); if (listItems.length === 0) return; var anyActive = false; listItems.forEach(function(item) { var checkbox = item.querySelector('input[type="checkbox"]'); if (checkbox) { if (checkbox.checked) { item.classList.add('active'); anyActive = true; // Set anyActive to true } else { item.classList.remove('active'); // Remove 'active' class if checkbox is unchecked } } }); } function updateButtonText(anyActive) { var subscribeButtonSpan = document.querySelector('.subscribe-submit .changeBtnText'); if (subscribeButtonSpan) { if (anyActive) { subscribeButtonSpan.textContent = 'Subscribe Now'; } else { subscribeButtonSpan.textContent = 'Unsubscribe'; } } } function updateSubscriptionButton() { var listItems = document.querySelectorAll('.subscription-options li'); if (listItems.length === 0) return; var anyActive = false; listItems.forEach(function(item) { var checkbox = item.querySelector('input[type="checkbox"]'); if (checkbox) { if (checkbox.checked) { item.classList.add('active'); anyActive = true; // Set anyActive to true } else { item.classList.remove('active'); // Remove 'active' class if checkbox is unchecked } } }); // Update the button text based on whether any list item has the 'active' class updateButtonText(anyActive); } document.addEventListener('click', function(event) { var clickedItem = event.target.closest('.subscription-options li'); if (clickedItem) { var checkbox = clickedItem.querySelector('input[type="checkbox"]'); if (checkbox) { checkbox.checked = !checkbox.checked; updateSubscriptionButton(); } } }); FAQs What was the DeFi Broker Rule? A proposed IRS regulation requiring DeFi platforms to report user transactions like traditional brokers, set to start in 2027. Why was it repealed? Critics argued it would harm innovation, invade privacy, and impose impossible demands on decentralized systems. How does this affect crypto users? It protects DeFi platforms from costly compliance, potentially lowering fees and encouraging new projects to stay in the U.S. What’s next for U.S. crypto policy? Expect debates on stablecoins, securities laws, and broader frameworks as Trump’s administration leans pro-crypto.

title: North Carolina’s Revolutionary Bill: Legalizing Bitcoin as Payment – A Crypto Breakthrough?
body: Is North Carolina about to become a beacon for Bitcoin adoption in the United States? A groundbreaking new bill, the North Carolina Digital Asset Freedom Act, has been introduced, and it’s sending ripples of excitement through the cryptocurrency community. Could this be a pivotal moment for Bitcoin and digital assets in the state and beyond? Let’s dive into what this bill entails and what it could mean for you. What’s Brewing in North Carolina? The Push for Bitcoin as Legal Payment Representative Neal Jackson is spearheading a legislative effort that could redefine how digital assets are perceived and utilized in North Carolina. The proposed North Carolina Digital Asset Freedom Act isn’t just another piece of legislation; it’s a bold step towards acknowledging the legitimacy and utility of decentralized cryptocurrencies, specifically those resembling Bitcoin . At its core, the bill seeks to recognize certain decentralized digital assets as lawful methods of payment within the state. But what exactly does this mean? Here’s a breakdown: Legal Tender Recognition: The bill aims to classify digital assets that meet specific criteria as legal forms of payment. This means businesses and individuals could legally use these assets for transactions, including paying taxes to the state. Specific Criteria for Recognition: The bill isn’t opening the door to every cryptocurrency out there. It sets forth stringent requirements for a digital asset to qualify, including: Proof-of-Work Mechanism: Assets must operate on a proof-of-work consensus mechanism, a hallmark of Bitcoin’s security and decentralization. Capped Supply: A limited, or capped, supply is another key criterion, mirroring Bitcoin’s scarcity and predictable monetary policy. Significant Market Capitalization: The asset must boast a market capitalization exceeding $750 billion. This benchmark effectively points directly to Bitcoin , as it is currently the only cryptocurrency that consistently meets this massive valuation. Implicit Bitcoin Focus: While the bill doesn’t explicitly name Bitcoin , the criteria are so narrowly defined that it strongly suggests Bitcoin is the intended beneficiary of this legislation. Following the CBDC Ban: Interestingly, this bill emerges shortly after North Carolina’s 2024 ban on Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs). This sequence of events could indicate a clear preference within the state legislature for decentralized, permissionless cryptocurrencies over centralized, government-controlled digital currencies. Why is North Carolina Considering This Move? Unpacking the Benefits of Legalizing Bitcoin So, why is North Carolina potentially paving the way for Bitcoin to become a recognized form of legal payment ? Let’s explore the potential advantages: Economic Innovation and Attractiveness: Embracing digital assets can position North Carolina as a forward-thinking, innovative state, attracting businesses and individuals within the burgeoning cryptocurrency and blockchain industries. This could lead to economic growth, job creation, and increased investment within the state. Financial Inclusion: Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin can offer alternative financial avenues for individuals who are unbanked or underbanked. By recognizing Bitcoin as legal payment , North Carolina could promote greater financial inclusion and accessibility for its residents. Reduced Transaction Costs: Cryptocurrency transactions can often have lower fees compared to traditional banking systems, especially for international transfers. This could benefit businesses and consumers alike. Enhanced Privacy and Control: Decentralized cryptocurrencies offer users greater control over their funds and potentially enhanced privacy compared to traditional financial systems. Tax Revenue Opportunities: By formally recognizing Bitcoin for tax payments, the state could streamline tax collection processes for cryptocurrency holders and potentially tap into a new revenue stream. Challenges and Considerations: Navigating the Road Ahead for Crypto Regulation While the North Carolina Digital Asset Freedom Act presents exciting possibilities, it’s crucial to acknowledge the challenges and considerations that come with integrating digital assets into the mainstream financial system. Here are some key points to ponder regarding crypto regulation : Challenge Description Volatility Cryptocurrency markets are known for their price volatility. This can pose challenges for businesses accepting Bitcoin for payments, as the value of the asset can fluctuate significantly in short periods. Regulatory Uncertainty The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving both at the state and federal levels. Navigating these uncertainties and ensuring compliance will be crucial. Consumer Education and Protection Widespread adoption of Bitcoin as legal payment will necessitate robust consumer education initiatives to ensure users understand the risks and opportunities associated with cryptocurrencies. Consumer protection measures will also be vital to safeguard users from fraud and scams. Infrastructure and Adoption For Bitcoin to function effectively as a legal payment method, the necessary infrastructure for seamless transactions needs to be in place. This includes payment processors, point-of-sale systems, and widespread merchant adoption. Environmental Concerns Proof-of-work cryptocurrencies, like Bitcoin , have faced criticism regarding their energy consumption. Addressing environmental concerns and promoting sustainable cryptocurrency practices will be important for long-term acceptance. Actionable Insights: What Does This Mean for You? Whether you’re a cryptocurrency enthusiast, a business owner in North Carolina, or simply curious about the future of finance, this bill warrants attention. Here’s what you can consider: Stay Informed: Keep track of the progress of the North Carolina Digital Asset Freedom Act. Follow legislative updates and news from reputable sources like Cointelegraph to understand how this bill is developing. Engage with Policymakers: If you’re a resident of North Carolina, consider contacting your representatives to express your views on this legislation. Your voice can influence the direction of crypto regulation in your state. Prepare Your Business: If you own a business in North Carolina, start thinking about the potential implications of Bitcoin becoming a legal payment option. Explore payment processing solutions and consider how you might integrate cryptocurrency payments into your operations. Educate Yourself on Bitcoin: Whether or not this bill passes, understanding Bitcoin and other digital assets is becoming increasingly important in our rapidly evolving financial landscape. Take the time to learn about the technology, its potential benefits, and associated risks. Conclusion: A Bold Step Towards a Digital Future? North Carolina’s proposed bill is undoubtedly a significant development in the ongoing conversation about cryptocurrency adoption and crypto regulation in the United States. By aiming to recognize Bitcoin -like assets as legal payment , North Carolina is not just following a trend; it’s potentially setting a precedent. This legislative push could ignite further discussions and actions in other states, accelerating the integration of digital assets into the mainstream economy. The journey towards widespread cryptocurrency adoption is complex and multifaceted, but initiatives like the North Carolina Digital Asset Freedom Act signal a compelling shift towards a more digitally inclusive financial future. The world is watching to see if North Carolina will indeed become a pioneer in this exciting new era. To learn more about the latest Bitcoin trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin institutional adoption.

title: Congress Puts Foot Down: Trump Signs Bill Overruling IRS on DeFi
body: New Act reverses untenble IRS DeFi rule that stifled innovation, faced opposition Bipartisan law shows Congress reasserting authority over regulators on crypto Bill sends clear message favoring supportive US environment for DeFi/crypto In the first major crypto legislative action, President Donald Trump signed on a bill repealing the controversial IRS’s Digital Assets Sale and Exchanges Rule, more commonly referred to as the DeFi Broker Rule. Hailing the move, Congressman Mike Carey posted “HISTORY MADE,” saying the law removes an undue burden from decentralized finance. What Was the IRS DeFi Broker Rule and Why Was It So Opposed? This rule came from Infrastructure Act changes, expanded the definition of a “broker” to include anyone transferring digital assets for a fee. Critics argued that applying the rule to self-hosted or non-custodial wallets and decentralized protocols was impossible to comply with and clearly aimed to stifle innovation. Opposition grew (>44k comments against the rule in 2023), spurring lawmaker support for repeal. Despite the backlash, in late 2024, the IRS under the Biden administration continued its enforcement ap… The post Congress Puts Foot Down: Trump Signs Bill Overruling IRS on DeFi appeared first on Coin Edition .

title: XRP Entering Grinding Phase After Boredom. Here’s the Significance
body: Crypto market analyst Egrag Crypto has shared a new technical outlook for XRP, indicating that the asset has transitioned from what he previously described as the “boredom phase” into a new phase he calls the “grinding phase.” In a tweet accompanied by a detailed chart, Egrag emphasized that the next movements for XRP may be slow and difficult in the short term, but he reaffirmed confidence in a longer-term breakout scenario , provided a critical support level holds. #XRP – After Boredom: Entering the Grinding Phase! Many of you remember that boredom phase I talked about it. We just came out of now and we’re in the Grinding Phase! Honestly, the yellow formation, blue formation, or any of the hundreds of formations don’t concern me in the… pic.twitter.com/9o69HaLLix — EGRAG CRYPTO (@egragcrypto) April 9, 2025 Support Line Becomes the Crucial Technical Marker The chart posted by Egrag outlines a falling wedge formation, typically considered a bullish reversal pattern when occurring in a downtrend. The chart shows XRP trading just above a yellow descending support trendline. This trendline appears to be acting as the lower boundary of the wedge pattern, and Egrag underscores its importance with the statement: “Lose this support line, we’re fooked.” This line currently sits just under the $1.80 region. Short-Term Movements Unclear, Structural Completion Preferred According to the analysis, Egrag sees two possible short-term trajectories within the wedge. The chart displays a yellow and a blue path, each illustrating a prolonged consolidation within the formation before a potential breakout. The blue path appears to track a more volatile grind within the formation, while the yellow suggests a lower low might form before a reversal occurs. Egrag suggests he would prefer this lower low form, as it would better complete the wedge pattern structurally and potentially set up for a stronger upside move. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Despite the short-term uncertainty, he maintains that XRP is positioned for a significant breakout. He identifies the primary resistance zone at approximately $2.73 and sets a measured move target at $4.00, aligning with the height of the wedge projected from the breakout point. While not specifying a timeline for this potential surge, the chart projection shows a steep move upward taking place sometime in the third quarter of 2025. Long-Term Outlook Remains Firm Despite Near-Term Volatility In his commentary, the analyst downplays the significance of various short-term formations, suggesting that the focus should remain on the long-term structural setup. “Honestly, the yellow formation, blue formation, or any of the hundreds of formations don’t concern me in the short term,” he wrote, pointing to the integrity of the support line as the primary technical priority. He concludes his tweet with encouragement directed at the XRP community, reinforcing his long-term optimism: “My long-term targets remain intact, so don’t get rattled!” Disclaimer : This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice. The views expressed in this article may include the author’s personal opinions and do not represent Times Tabloid’s opinion. Readers are urged to do in-depth research before making any investment decisions. Any action taken by the reader is strictly at their own risk. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. Follow us on X , Facebook , Telegram , and Google News The post XRP Entering Grinding Phase After Boredom. Here’s the Significance appeared first on Times Tabloid .

title: Analyst Unveils Level Bitcoin Bulls Must Defend To Avoid Massive Plunge, Maps Path Forward for S&P 500 Index
body: A widely followed analyst believes Bitcoin ( BTC ) will remain in a bull cycle if the flagship crypto asset holds one key level as support. In a new video update, crypto strategist Benjamin Cowen tells his 892,000 YouTube subscribers that if Bitcoin falls below $69,000, a bear market phase may ensue. “In the short term for Bitcoin, the good news is that we’ve maintained above the 2024 high; we maintained above that. And that’s a good thing. And I still think that Bitcoin could go all the way down to $69,000 and the structure of the market stay intact. But below that, I would not be as optimistic. Okay, I wouldn’t be. This is the zone [between $73,617 and $69,048] where you really would want to see the bulls come to the table and hold support because if they don’t, and if it comes down here [below $69,000], that’s probably it.” Source: Benjamin Cowen/YouTube Bitcoin is trading for $79,752 at time of writing, down 4.3% in the last 24 hours. Cowen also believes that either US President Donald Trump or the Fed will take action in the coming months to counter drastic downward moves in the stock market as Trump keeps his tariff war going. “I think there are levels in the market where the powers that be will try to step in and try and encourage market participants to take on risk and to get more exposure. And I think there is a chance here that we just figured out where that is for the President, and it’s a 20% drawdown in the S&P or potentially the 10-year yield skyrocketing. Now, we don’t yet know… where the Fed will then come to the rescue. We don’t know that yet…. So it’s one of those things where, if the President steps in and reduces some of the uncertainty, then the Fed might not have to do anything, but if he continues on with it, then we’ll figure out where the Fed put is. If we get out into July and all this tariff stuff just comes right back, then we might figure out where the Fed will actually start to try to intervene. But I thought that this was the level that the President decided it was time to try to intervene and figure something else out.” Source: Benjamin Cowen/YouTube Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Don't Miss a Beat – Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Explosive Growth: 100 Public Companies Now Embrace Bitcoin – Is Your Portfolio Ready?
body: The world of cryptocurrency continues its march into mainstream finance, and a significant milestone has just been reached. According to data from Solid Intel, the number of publicly traded companies holding Bitcoin (BTC) has soared to 100! This landmark figure signals a growing acceptance and integration of Bitcoin into traditional corporate treasury strategies. But what does this mean for the crypto market, for these companies, and for you as an investor? Let’s dive deep into this exciting development and uncover the implications of this institutional Bitcoin adoption. Why Are Public Companies Embracing Institutional Bitcoin Adoption? The decision for public companies to allocate a portion of their treasury to Bitcoin is not taken lightly. It’s a strategic move driven by a confluence of factors, reflecting a fundamental shift in how businesses view and manage their assets. Let’s explore some key drivers behind this institutional Bitcoin adoption : Hedge Against Inflation: With fiat currencies facing inflationary pressures, Bitcoin is increasingly seen as a viable hedge. Its limited supply of 21 million coins contrasts sharply with the potentially unlimited supply of government-issued currencies, making it an attractive store of value in times of economic uncertainty. Diversification: Smart financial management emphasizes diversification. Holding Bitcoin allows companies to diversify their treasury beyond traditional assets like cash and bonds, potentially reducing overall portfolio risk and enhancing returns. Yield Enhancement: In a low-interest-rate environment, Bitcoin presents an opportunity for yield enhancement. While volatile, Bitcoin’s potential for significant price appreciation can outperform traditional low-yield assets over the long term. Technological Disruption and Future-Proofing: Embracing Bitcoin can be viewed as a forward-thinking move, aligning companies with technological innovation. It signals an understanding of the evolving financial landscape and positions them to benefit from the potential of blockchain technology and digital assets in the future. Following Market Leaders: The early adoption of Bitcoin by companies like MicroStrategy and Tesla has paved the way and provided a degree of validation for other public companies. Seeing successful examples reduces perceived risk and encourages others to explore similar strategies. What are the Benefits for Public Companies Holding Bitcoin? Beyond the motivations, what tangible benefits do public companies expect to gain from including corporate Bitcoin holdings in their portfolios? The advantages are multifaceted and can impact various aspects of their business. Enhanced Investor Appeal: In today’s market, showing innovation and embracing future-oriented technologies can attract investors. Companies holding Bitcoin may be seen as more progressive and forward-thinking, potentially boosting investor confidence and stock valuations. Improved Balance Sheet Performance: If Bitcoin appreciates in value, it directly impacts the company’s balance sheet, increasing its asset value. This can lead to stronger financial metrics and improved credit ratings over time. Brand Differentiation: Being among the first in a traditional sector to adopt Bitcoin can create a unique selling proposition and differentiate a company from its competitors. It can attract customers and talent who value innovation and technological advancement. Access to New Markets and Demographics: Cryptocurrency adoption is particularly strong among younger demographics and in emerging markets. Holding Bitcoin can signal to these groups that the company is attuned to their preferences and potentially open up new market opportunities. Potential for Future Integration: As the crypto ecosystem matures, companies holding Bitcoin are better positioned to integrate it into their operations, whether for payments, supply chain management, or other innovative applications. Challenges and Considerations for Corporate Bitcoin Holdings While the potential benefits are compelling, navigating corporate Bitcoin holdings is not without its challenges. Public companies must carefully consider several factors before venturing into this space: Volatility: Bitcoin’s price volatility is perhaps the most significant concern. Dramatic price swings can impact a company’s balance sheet and financial reporting, requiring robust risk management strategies. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving globally. Companies must navigate complex and often unclear regulations related to accounting, taxation, and compliance, which vary significantly across jurisdictions. Security and Custody: Securing large amounts of Bitcoin requires robust custody solutions and cybersecurity measures. Companies must choose reputable custodians and implement best practices to protect their digital assets from theft or loss. Accounting and Reporting Standards: Accounting for Bitcoin holdings is not straightforward. Current accounting standards may not perfectly align with the nature of digital assets, requiring careful interpretation and potentially impacting financial reporting. Operational Complexity: Integrating Bitcoin into treasury operations requires new expertise and processes. Companies need to develop in-house capabilities or partner with specialists to manage Bitcoin transactions, custody, and reporting effectively. Public Perception and ESG Concerns: Bitcoin’s energy consumption and environmental impact are subjects of ongoing debate. Companies must be prepared to address potential public perception issues and consider sustainable practices in their crypto strategies, especially given increasing ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) scrutiny. Examples of Public Companies with BTC on Balance Sheet The list of public companies with BTC on balance sheet is growing, representing diverse sectors and geographical locations. Here are a few notable examples: Company Ticker Sector Estimated BTC Holdings MicroStrategy MSTR Software ~190,000+ BTC Tesla TSLA Automotive ~9,720 BTC (as of reports, may vary) Marathon Digital Holdings MARA Bitcoin Mining ~17,631 BTC Hut 8 Mining Corp HUT Bitcoin Mining ~9,110 BTC Coinbase Global, Inc. COIN Cryptocurrency Exchange ~9,000+ BTC Actionable Insights: What Does This Mean for Investors? The increasing institutional Bitcoin adoption has significant implications for both retail and institutional investors: Increased Market Maturity: More institutional involvement generally leads to greater market maturity, potentially reducing volatility over the long term and increasing market liquidity. Validation of Bitcoin as an Asset Class: When public companies allocate treasury to Bitcoin, it reinforces Bitcoin’s legitimacy as a recognized and investable asset class, further driving mainstream acceptance. Potential for Price Appreciation: Increased demand from institutional buyers can contribute to upward price pressure on Bitcoin, potentially benefiting existing Bitcoin holders and attracting new investors. Exposure to Bitcoin Through Traditional Investments: Investors can gain indirect exposure to Bitcoin’s price movements by investing in the stocks of public companies that hold BTC. This can be an alternative or complementary approach to directly holding Bitcoin. Due Diligence is Still Key: While institutional adoption is a positive sign, investors should still conduct thorough due diligence before investing in Bitcoin or companies holding Bitcoin. Understand the risks involved and align investments with personal financial goals and risk tolerance. Conclusion: A New Era for Bitcoin and Corporate Finance? Reaching the milestone of 100 public companies holding Bitcoin is more than just a number; it’s a powerful indicator of a fundamental shift in corporate finance and investment strategies. This explosive growth signals a growing confidence in Bitcoin as a store of value, a hedge against inflation, and a key component of a diversified treasury. While challenges remain, the trend is clear: institutional Bitcoin adoption is accelerating, potentially paving the way for a new era where digital assets play an increasingly prominent role in the global financial landscape. As more companies explore and embrace Bitcoin, the implications for the crypto market and the broader economy are likely to be profound and transformative. The journey of Bitcoin into the heart of corporate treasury is just beginning, and the next chapter promises to be even more compelling. title: World Liberty Says it Hasn't Sold Any Ether, Refutes Arkham Data
body: World Liberty Financial, the DeFi project backed by U.S. President Donald Trump's family, has denied reports that it sold ether (ETH) earlier this week. It was reported on Wednesday that a wallet closely linked to World Liberty Financial, which is tagged by blockchain data firm Arkham as potentially belonging to the project, sold $8 million worth of ether after surpassing $125 million in unrealized losses. In a statement to CoinDesk, a World Liberty Financial spokesperson said: "The claims that World Liberty Financial has sold any of its holdings are wholly inaccurate. WLFI has not sold any positions as currently reported. Speculation to the contrary is false." Ether has since rebounded since that sale at $1,465, currently trading at $1,553 after the crypto markets experience a minor period of relief on Wednesday. Donald Trump's son, Eric, said that it was a "great time to buy" ETH in February when it traded at $2,880. Arkham did not respond to CoinDesk's request for comment.

title: Florida joins Bitcoin reserve race with first committee approval of HB 487
body: Florida has taken its first legislative step toward embracing Bitcoin as a state-held asset, joining the race led by Arizona and closely followed by New Hampshire. Florida is the latest U.S. state to make strides toward adopting Bitcoin ( BTC ) as a strategic reserve asset, as its House Bill 487 (HB 487) passed through the House Insurance and Banking Subcommittee with unanimous support on April 10 hearing . The bill , titled “Investments of Public Funds in Bitcoin,” proposes allowing Florida’s Chief Financial Officer and State Board of Administration to invest up to 10% of key public funds — including the General Revenue Fund and Budget Stabilization Fund — into Bitcoin. It outlines strict custody, security, and compliance protocols, and also enables Bitcoin held by the state to be loaned out or used in exchange-traded products. Having cleared the first of four committees, HB 487 must still pass through the Government Operations Subcommittee, the Ways & Means Committee, and the Commerce Committee before heading to the full House for a vote. If passed by the House, the bill will move to the Senate for consideration and, ultimately, the governor’s desk. You might also like: New Hampshire House passes Bitcoin reserve bill in close vote Florida’s push comes amid a wider trend across U.S. states exploring Bitcoin as a sovereign asset class. According to Bitcoin Laws, Arizona appears to be leading the legislative race. As of late March, its Senate Bills 1373 and 1025 — both related to digital asset reserves — have passed through the Senate and cleared the House Rules Committee. These bills are now headed for a full House vote. If successful, they would only require Governor Katie Hobbs ’ signature to become law, making Arizona the first state to officially adopt a Bitcoin reserve policy. Source: Bitcoin Laws Meanwhile, New Hampshire has also advanced its Bitcoin reserve bill (HB 302), which passed the full House in a 192-179 vote and is now under Senate review. The bill would allow the state treasurer to allocate up to 10% of authorized funds into Bitcoin and precious metals, but only assets with a market cap exceeding $500 billion — a threshold currently met only by Bitcoin — would qualify. You might also like: Florida bill proposes investing in Bitcoin, first hearing set for April 10

title: Ethereum Price Mirrors Nokia Downfall As Solana Market Share Surges – Is ETH Dying?
body: Ethereum price performance is mirroring the downfall of Nokia according to a top market analyst. The largest altcoin struggles against its top rivals like Ripple (XRP) and Solana (SOL), which are gradually eating into its market share. Ethereum’s struggle follows reduced utility for ETH due to the prominence of layer 2 networks and lack of demand. Amid this shift, will Ethereum be the next Nokia and Solana the next Apple? Let’s find out. Ethereum Price Mirrors Nokia Downfall According to Crypto Curb, Ethereum price performance in the last four years looks similar to the rise and fall of Nokia. Just like Nokia, ETH has hit two main peaks in its history before crumbling to the present range lows. At press time, Ethereum struggled at two-year lows . This highlights failure to sustain high demand after its initial hype. Ethereum vs. Nokia CryptoCurb went ahead and added that Ethereum’s main competitor is Solana, which will likely displace it just like Apple did Nokia. His analysis adds to the years-long discussion within the Solana community on when SOL will flip Ethereum price and market cap to become the largest altcoin. The comparison of Ethereum and Nokia is based on several similarities. Just like Nokia, ETH saw much adoption, usage, and demand in its early years. However, it failed to evolve as fast as the dApp market grew, which created a gap that Solana filled with its low fees and fast speeds. Ethereum Market Share Under Threat From Rival Solana CryptoCurb’s analysis further noted that Solana is currently a third of the Ethereum market cap of $186 billion. The next target for SOL is to attain half of the market cap, which will place it on the path to overtake ETH. Solana vs. Ethereum Market Cap He added that there was a minimal chance that the Ethereum price would recover due to weak fundamentals and being overpriced. Per CryptoCurb “At some point, you have to look at the fundamentals over the technicals – ETH is still overpriced in comparison with its competitor (ETH at 3x the MC of SOL).” However, other analysts defended Ethereum , adding that the altcoin still has room to recover. Cryptobetzzz noted, “Comparing it to Nokia is just a little interesting. It’s a bit of a stretch but I do believe that it’s a scenario however an unlikely one.” Into The Cryptoverse CEO Benjamin Cowen also slammed Solana maxis saying they failed to acknowledge that SOL is also headed for the same downfall as Ethereum. Per Cowen’s bearish Ethereum price prediction , SOL/BTC is following ETH/BTC , which recently reached a five-year low. Ethereum Price Technical Analysis Ethereum price is under intense bearish pressure and selling activity. The RSI on the weekly chart has made several lower lows. At the same time, the AO bars show that bears are gaining strength. The only chance that this altcoin has to trigger a bullish Ethereum price forecast is if it bounces from the current demand zone between $1,500 and $1,600. Once it does this, it could pave the way for the next rally higher and possibly extend its gains past $2,000. ETH/USDT: 1-Week Chart To sum up, Ethereum price has a negative outlook as depicted by the similarities between its performance and that of Nokia. As Solana gains market share due to its advantages over ETH, Ethereum could be displaced and lose its status as the largest altcoin. title: Relief for Crypto: Trump Vetoes IRS Broker Reporting Rule in Landmark Victory
body: In a significant win for the cryptocurrency industry, former U.S. President Donald Trump has signed a joint resolution to repeal a contentious Internal Revenue Service (IRS) rule targeting crypto brokers. This move, championed by Republican Senator Ted Cruz and Representative Mike Carey, effectively nullifies the “DeFi Broker Rule,” a regulation that had sparked considerable debate and opposition within the digital asset space. The repeal marks a pivotal moment, hailed as the first crypto-related legislation ever signed into law, signaling a potential shift in the regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies in the United States. What is the IRS Crypto Rule and Why Was it Controversial? The now-repealed IRS crypto rule, officially known as the “DeFi Broker Rule,” aimed to impose stringent data collection and reporting obligations on entities deemed “custodial brokers” within the cryptocurrency ecosystem. But what exactly did this entail, and why did it face such strong headwinds from the crypto community? Broad Definition of Broker: The core issue lay in the expansive definition of a “broker” under the proposed rule. Critics argued that it could encompass not just centralized exchanges, but also decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms, miners, and even software developers who might not traditionally be considered brokers. This broad interpretation raised concerns about overreach and impractical implementation. Data Collection Burden: The rule mandated “custodial brokers” to collect and report extensive information on their users, including transaction details and counterparty information. For DeFi protocols and decentralized entities, this posed a significant technical and operational challenge, as these platforms are often designed to minimize data collection and operate without intermediaries. Privacy Concerns: The crypto industry voiced strong privacy concerns, arguing that the rule could lead to excessive surveillance and erode the fundamental principles of decentralization and financial privacy that underpin many cryptocurrencies. Innovation Stifling: Many in the crypto space feared that the burdensome reporting requirements would stifle innovation and drive crypto businesses and users away from the United States to more favorable regulatory jurisdictions. Essentially, the crypto industry viewed the “DeFi Broker Rule” as a misguided attempt to apply traditional financial regulations to a nascent and fundamentally different technological paradigm. The industry argued for a more nuanced and tailored approach to crypto regulation that acknowledges the unique characteristics of digital assets and fosters innovation rather than hindering it. Trump’s Intervention: A Victory Lap for Crypto Advocates? President Trump’s decision to sign the joint resolution is being celebrated as a major victory by crypto regulation advocates. The resolution, introduced by crypto-friendly lawmakers Senator Ted Cruz and Representative Mike Carey, gained bipartisan support in Congress, highlighting a growing recognition of the need to address the concerns of the crypto industry. Representative Carey emphasized the historic nature of this event, noting it as the “first crypto-related legislation ever signed into law,” signaling a potential turning point in how the U.S. government approaches digital asset policy. Key Benefits of Repealing the IRS Crypto Rule: Reduced Regulatory Burden: The repeal immediately alleviates the regulatory burden on crypto businesses, particularly DeFi platforms, miners, and smaller entities that would have struggled to comply with the complex reporting requirements. Encourages Innovation: By removing the threat of overly burdensome regulations, the repeal is expected to foster innovation and growth within the U.S. crypto industry, encouraging entrepreneurs and developers to build and operate within the country. Protects Privacy: The repeal addresses privacy concerns by preventing the potentially excessive data collection that the “DeFi Broker Rule” could have enabled. Global Competitiveness: A more favorable regulatory environment could enhance the United States’ competitiveness in the global crypto landscape, attracting investment and talent. Crypto Broker Reporting : What Happens Next? While the repeal of the “DeFi Broker Rule” is a significant victory, it doesn’t mean the end of crypto broker reporting discussions. It is more likely a reset, prompting regulators and lawmakers to reconsider a more balanced and informed approach to crypto regulation. Here are some potential next steps and considerations: Revised Regulatory Framework: The IRS and other regulatory bodies may now need to develop a revised regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies that is more tailored to the specific characteristics of digital assets and DeFi. This could involve engaging with the crypto industry to understand its nuances and challenges. Clarity on Broker Definition: A crucial aspect of future regulations will be to establish a clearer and more precise definition of “broker” in the context of cryptocurrencies, ensuring that it targets genuine intermediaries without inadvertently capturing decentralized protocols or non-custodial entities. Focus on Risk-Based Approach: Future crypto regulation might adopt a more risk-based approach, focusing on areas where consumer protection and financial stability are most at risk, such as centralized exchanges and illicit activities, rather than imposing blanket rules on the entire crypto ecosystem. International Coordination: Given the global nature of cryptocurrencies, international coordination on regulatory standards will be increasingly important to prevent regulatory arbitrage and ensure a level playing field. IRS Crypto Rule : A Look at the Road Ahead The journey of IRS crypto rule development is far from over. While the current rule has been repealed, the need for regulatory clarity and oversight in the crypto space remains. The repeal provides an opportunity for a more constructive dialogue between regulators, lawmakers, and the crypto industry to forge a path forward that balances innovation, consumer protection, and responsible growth. Potential Challenges and Considerations: Balancing Innovation and Regulation: The key challenge will be to strike the right balance between fostering innovation in the rapidly evolving crypto space and implementing necessary regulations to mitigate risks and protect consumers. Enforcement and Compliance: Even with a more tailored regulatory framework, effective enforcement and compliance will be crucial. This may require new tools and approaches to monitor and regulate decentralized and global crypto activities. Education and Understanding: Policymakers and regulators need to deepen their understanding of cryptocurrency technology and its implications to create informed and effective regulations. Industry Collaboration: Ongoing collaboration and dialogue between regulators and the crypto industry are essential to ensure that regulations are practical, effective, and do not stifle innovation. Trump Crypto Move: What Does it Mean for the Future? Donald Trump’s decision on the crypto broker reporting rule is being interpreted by many as a positive signal towards the crypto industry. While the long-term implications remain to be seen, this move could indicate a growing political willingness to accommodate and support the growth of the cryptocurrency sector in the United States. It also highlights the increasing political salience of crypto as a topic that can attract bipartisan attention and action. Actionable Insights for Crypto Participants: Stay Informed: Keep abreast of evolving regulatory developments in the crypto space, both in the U.S. and globally. Engage in Advocacy: Participate in industry advocacy efforts to shape future regulations and ensure that the crypto industry’s voice is heard. Prepare for Future Regulations: While the current rule is repealed, it is likely that new regulations will emerge. Crypto businesses should proactively prepare for future compliance requirements. Focus on Compliance and Best Practices: Even in the absence of specific regulations, adhering to best practices in security, transparency, and user protection is crucial for building trust and long-term sustainability in the crypto space. Conclusion: A Sigh of Relief, But the Journey Continues President Trump’s signing of the resolution to repeal the IRS “DeFi Broker Rule” represents a significant relief and a notable victory for the cryptocurrency industry. It underscores the growing influence of the crypto lobby and signals a potential shift towards a more balanced regulatory approach. However, the journey of crypto regulation is far from over. The industry must remain vigilant, proactive, and engaged in shaping the future regulatory landscape to ensure that innovation thrives alongside responsible growth and consumer protection. This repeal is not the finish line, but rather a crucial milestone in the ongoing evolution of crypto in the United States. To learn more about the latest crypto regulation trends, explore our article on key developments shaping crypto policy landscape.

title: Dollar slides to decade-low, US assets hit by loss of confidence
body: On Friday, the US dollar slid to its weakest level in over a decade, as investors abandoned US assets over economic instability and policy uncertainty concerns. The decline of the greenback triggered a flight to other currencies and assets, including the Swiss franc, Japanese yen, euro, and gold, all surging in a week of ups and downs. The Dollar Index (DXY), a benchmark that measures the US currency against a basket of six major peers, fell 0.85% on Friday to 100.009. The index briefly dipped below the psychological 100 level for the first time since July 2023. Over the past month, DXY has shed 3.48%, down 5.66% over the last year. According to Chris Weston, head of research at Pepperstone, markets witnessed a “pronounced ‘sell USD'” sentiment, and capital was “migrating away from Ground Zero.” “ The USD is losing the safe-haven bid ,” Weston remarked. Dollar struggles create demand for other currencies, gold Data from TradingEconomics show the greenback dropped as much as 1.2% against the Swiss franc to 0.81405, the lowest since January 2015. It also slipped 1.1% against the yen to 142.88, marking its weakest since September 30. Against the Canadian dollar, the US currency slumped 0.5% to a five-month low of C$1.3910, while the euro rallied 1.7% to $1.13855, a level last seen in February 2022. Investors fleeing US assets drove up demand for gold, which climbed to a record $3,219.96 per ounce this week. Since the start of 2025, the precious metal has gained more than 22%, tracking its benchmark price on CFD markets. “ We are entering a pure ‘sell USD’ regime. Rate differentials are losing their sway over the USD for the first time in my life ,” reckoned Brent Donnelly, president of Spectra Markets. Markets were jolted a few times this week, and the frenzy continued after President Donald Trump abruptly announced a 90-day pause on higher tariffs on Wednesday for dozens of US trading partners. The unexpected reversal came after the US administration was bombarded with criticism from policymakers, who feared Trump was leading America into a recession. Yet, the stubborn POTUS did not extend the pause to China. Trump increased import duties to an effective 145%, which escalated the already tense economic standoff between Washington and Beijing. On Thursday, the White House clarified that a new 20% levy had been added to the initial 125% duty on Chinese imports. The tariff spike had caused the Chinese yuan to tumble to an all-time low in offshore trading. However, the currency recovered in subsequent sessions, ending the day at 7.3211 yuan per dollar and up 0.1% on Friday’s pre-market sessions. Wall Street reverses relief rally Markets initially reacted positively to Trump’s tariff pause, which started a brief relief rally that pushed the S&P 500 index past the 5,000 mark on Wednesday after falling to a 2025 low. But sentiment soured rapidly, and Wall Street stocks plunged again yesterday. According to Yahoo Finance data, the S&P 500 fell nearly 3.5% at Thursday’s market close, while the Nasdaq Composite (IXIC), dominated by tech stocks, sank 4.3%. The Dow Jones Industrial Average also tanked by around 1,000 points, or approximately 2.5%. “ People were getting a little queasy ,” Trump acknowledged on Wednesday, referring to the selloff in US Treasuries. The president admitted watching the bond market closely as investor nerves frayed. On the US debt side, the benchmark 10-year yield surged nearly 10 basis points on Friday to 4.488%, its steepest weekly rise since 2001. The 20-year bond yield climbed to 4.941%, continuing a month-long uptrend. The unusual tandem drop in both stocks and bonds triggered alarm. During periods of crisis, investors flock to Treasuries for safety. But this week, they fled from them, reportedly rattling the White House. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent claimed the tariff retreat had been planned to lure nations back to negotiations. “ The bond market spooked the president ,” Ed Yardeni, president of Yardeni Research, told CNN. “ Bond vigilantes were screaming that they weren’t happy…and there was a potential for a recession.” Mohit Kumar, chief economist at Jefferies, called Trump’s change of “a blink” forced by markets. “ The reversal is in sharp contrast to the fanfare with which Trump unveiled his tariff policy just a week ago ,” he noted. title: Trump Risks Unleash Crypto Value Surge: Expert Bitcoin Analysis
body: Buckle up, crypto enthusiasts! The ever-turbulent world of politics is once again intertwining with the digital finance realm, and this time, the spotlight is on former U.S. President Donald Trump. A fascinating new analysis from South Korea’s NH Investment & Securities suggests that the very risks associated with Trump’s political maneuvers could act as a potent catalyst, potentially unleashing a significant surge in crypto value . Let’s dive deep into how ‘Trump risks’ might just be the unexpected tailwind that propels cryptocurrencies, especially Bitcoin, to new heights. Decoding Trump Risks: How They Fuel Crypto Value NH Investment & Securities, a prominent financial institution based in South Korea, has released an insightful analysis highlighting a counter-intuitive connection: political and economic uncertainties stemming from Donald Trump could inadvertently boost the appeal and, consequently, the crypto value . Their report, featured in Asia Business Daily, points to a weakening dollar influence as a key consequence of these ‘Trump risks’, creating a fertile ground for alternative assets like cryptocurrencies to flourish. But what exactly are these ‘Trump risks’ that could trigger such a shift? According to the analyst at NH Investment & Securities, the concerns are multifaceted and deeply rooted in potential policy shifts and economic strategies under a Trump administration. These risks are not just abstract political chatter; they have tangible implications for the global financial landscape. Key Trump Risks & Their Crypto Value Impact: Debt Ceiling Standoffs: Trump’s history includes aggressive negotiation tactics, particularly when it comes to the U.S. debt ceiling. Failure to reach a swift agreement could rattle global markets and erode confidence in the dollar. In such scenarios, investors often seek refuge in decentralized and independent assets like Bitcoin, driving up its crypto value . Treasury Debt Restructuring: The mere suggestion of restructuring U.S. Treasury debt – considered a bedrock of global finance – sends shivers down the spines of traditional investors. Such a move would be unprecedented and could severely damage the dollar’s reputation as a safe haven asset. Cryptocurrencies, seen as an alternative to traditional financial systems, could become increasingly attractive. Threats to Federal Reserve Independence: A recurring theme in Trump’s rhetoric has been criticism of the Federal Reserve and its monetary policy. Any perceived threat to the Fed’s independence could destabilize the dollar and push investors towards decentralized digital currencies, impacting crypto value positively. The Specter of a Third Trump Term: The possibility of another Trump presidency introduces policy uncertainty. His past actions and pronouncements on trade, international relations, and economic policy create volatility, which can be beneficial for alternative assets like cryptocurrencies. Trade Wars and Deficit Reduction: Trump’s protectionist trade policies and focus on reducing trade deficits could lead to global economic friction and dollar weakness. In an environment of trade tensions and currency fluctuations, the fixed supply and borderless nature of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies become compelling features. Bitcoin: The Apex Beneficiary of Dollar Doubt? The NH Investment & Securities analysis specifically highlights Bitcoin’s potential to benefit from these ‘Trump risks’. Why Bitcoin? Because Bitcoin, since its inception, has been envisioned as a digital gold, a decentralized alternative to fiat currencies, particularly the U.S. dollar. The analyst suggests that Trump’s policies, whether intentionally or unintentionally, might be accelerating the very scenario Bitcoin’s creators foresaw: a weakening of the dollar’s global dominance. Bitcoin ‘s inherent characteristics position it uniquely to capitalize on dollar uncertainty: Decentralization: Unlike the dollar, which is controlled by the Federal Reserve, Bitcoin operates on a decentralized network, free from government or central bank influence. This makes it less susceptible to political and policy risks. Limited Supply: Bitcoin’s capped supply of 21 million coins is a stark contrast to fiat currencies, which can be printed at will. This scarcity is a core value proposition, especially during times of inflation or currency devaluation. Global Accessibility: Bitcoin transactions are borderless and permissionless. In a world potentially fractured by trade wars and geopolitical tensions, this global accessibility is a significant advantage. Store of Value Narrative: Bitcoin’s narrative as a store of value, akin to gold, gains traction when traditional safe-haven assets like the dollar face headwinds. Dollar Influence Under Scrutiny: A Crypto Springboard? The report emphasizes the weakening dollar influence as a crucial factor. For decades, the U.S. dollar has reigned supreme as the world’s reserve currency. However, geopolitical shifts, rising national debts, and alternative financial systems are challenging this dominance. ‘Trump risks’, in this context, could be seen as accelerating an existing trend of diversification away from the dollar. If the dollar’s influence wanes, investors and nations alike may seek alternative stores of value and mediums of exchange. Cryptocurrencies, with Bitcoin leading the charge, are increasingly being viewed as viable alternatives. This shift in perception can have a profound impact on the long-term crypto value and adoption rates. Navigating the Volatility: Actionable Insights for Crypto Investors While the analysis suggests a potential upside for cryptocurrencies from ‘Trump risks’, it’s crucial to remember that the crypto market is inherently volatile. Here are some actionable insights for navigating this landscape: Insight Actionable Step Stay Informed Keep abreast of geopolitical developments, U.S. economic policy announcements, and expert analyses of ‘Trump risks’. Diversify Don’t put all your eggs in one basket. Diversify your crypto portfolio and consider a mix of asset classes. Manage Risk Understand your risk tolerance and invest accordingly. Crypto investments should be part of a well-rounded financial strategy. Long-Term Perspective Focus on the long-term potential of cryptocurrencies rather than short-term market fluctuations driven by political events. Due Diligence Thoroughly research any cryptocurrency before investing. Understand the technology, use cases, and market dynamics. Conclusion: Trump Risks – A Double-Edged Sword for Crypto? The analysis from NH Investment & Securities presents a compelling, albeit nuanced, perspective. ‘Trump risks’, while potentially disruptive to traditional markets, could paradoxically serve as a catalyst for cryptocurrency adoption and value appreciation, particularly for Bitcoin. The weakening dollar influence , driven by these risks, creates an environment where decentralized, alternative assets become increasingly attractive. However, it’s vital to approach this potential upside with caution and a thorough understanding of market volatility and risk management. The intersection of politics and crypto is rarely predictable, but it certainly makes for fascinating times in the world of digital finance. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Trump seeks to fire Fed Chair Jerome Powell via the Supreme Court. Good news for the crypto market?
body: The Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has been named one of the unluckiest Fed chairs as he has to deal with a terrible mess created by Donald Trump’s tariffs policy. Since Powell ignored Trump’s urges to cut interest rates, Trump decided to fire him via the Supreme Court. Let’s dive deeper into the nature of this conflict and figure out if Powell’s resignation would be good for crypto. What led to the conflict? First off, the Powell-Trump conflict is not new. The consistent leaning of Powell’s Fed towards keeping interest rates high to keep inflation in check has always been a problem for Trump. However, in December 2024, Trump said he would not try to make Powell go. However, it seems Trump has had enough this time. Tariffs deployed on trading with dozens of countries on the so-called Liberation Day on Apr. 2, 2025, have seriously shaken the stock market around the globe. The crypto markets responded with 10 to 20 percent downfalls on Apr. 7. The same day, many stock markets saw the worst drops in value in decades. Crypto liquidations reached around $888 million on that day. American markets saw lower declines. Partly, this can be explained by the rumors of a possible 90-day pause on tariffs. The White House rejected the news as fake news, but later, it turned out that it was true, except for China. Instead, the U.S. deployed even harsher tariffs on China, raising it to 145% as of press time. The media called tariffs a “shock” for the economy and the markets. Read more: Markets close lower as Trump notes tariff problems and Fed flags recession risk The fear greed index has reached a strong “extreme fear” point following the Liberation Day and the following week. The situation began to look threatening for small businesses in the U.S., as Pershing Square CEO Bill Ackman vividly outlined in an X post shown below. Our stock market is down. Bond yields are up and the dollar is declining. These are not the markers of successful policy. I am receiving an increasing number of emails and texts from small business people I do business with or have invested in, expressing fear that they will… — Bill Ackman (@BillAckman) April 9, 2025 Donald Trump expressed no regrets about bombing the markets. In February, he even warned the public about the “pain” that tariffs may bring to Americans. He suggested that it is a reasonable price for the golden age of America to come. Nevertheless, the 90-day pause and the openness for negotiations with many countries, including China, changed the vibe. Some think that Trump deliberately wanted to scare other countries to make them negotiate on America’s terms. Others believe Trump capitulated to angered billionaires and investors. Either way, many don’t understand how the hurdles set for American companies with manufacturing operations in China can help America thrive. Indeed. I’d go so far as to say that the US is now viewed as an extremely unreliable trading partner by the rest of the world. Whilst some may hope to lessen any short-term shocks to their economies, they’ve all learned about the danger of dealing with a country that can change… — Andy (@andyturner) April 10, 2025 On Apr. 10, it was revealed that the inflation rate in the U.S. dropped. Although Trump reacted to the news of declining inflation positively, he sought the interest rate cut as a remedy to the market’s shakeup. The decision should be made by the Fed, which is an independent agency. Jerome Powell, a chair of this independent agency, showed reluctance to cut the rates. https://twitter.com/Cointelegraph/status/1910329551772623311 Powell vs. Trump According to a recent WSJ article, Powell is facing a no-win situation in which he cannot make a perfect decision whether to cut the rates or not. Either way will cause harm to the economy. Rate cuts will unleash inflation while keeping the rates as they are ignoring the slowing down economy and letting the labor market fall, which in turn will cause inflation to surge anyway. Huh? Powell said on Friday that the Fed won't cut until the economic results of the tariffs are reflected in the data. You can't possibly say that today's data includes tariff pressure. The tariff wars just started last week. Moreover, @APompliano is arguing that the data lags… — David D. Tawil (@DavidDTawil) April 10, 2025 Yet, Powell sees no reason to cut the rates and sticks to holding down inflation and tamping down the risks for the economy. On Apr. 4, he said that central banks should first assess the high-paced trade policy changes unleashed by Trump. Seemingly, Donald Trump is not impressed with this contrariness, so he allegedly seeks to oust Powell through the Supreme Court. According to the Bloomberg report, Trump petitioned the Supreme Court to fire high-profile officials from two independent agencies. This could be a potential attack on Powell, who recently admitted that he would not resign until the end of his term. If the Supreme Court dismantles the 1935 precedent set by Humphrey’s Executor vs. the United States case, Powell may end up being fired. The precedent increases the protection of his current position and saves him from firing by executive power. However, the precedent may be seen as conflicting with Article II of the Constitution, which Trump can use as legal grounds to terminate Powell. Such an approach may be seen as Trump’s stunt to concentrate much power in his hands and decrease decentralization in the government. On the other hand, investors wishing for rate cuts may praise the move if it actually takes place. Would the crypto market benefit from Powell’s resignation? In December 2024, Powell announced a low interest rate cut, reversing the crypto bull run that was in full swing at that time. He was hardly seen as a crypto ally at that time. On other occasions, though, Powell has been supportive; for instance, he critiqued the debanking of the crypto clients by financial institutions. Earlier, the Fed signaled its intention to cut the rates in 2026, which would have paved the way for further Bitcoin adoption in the future. Trump may try to nominate a more pro-crypto Kevin Warsh as Powell’s successor or find someone more submissive, who will cut the rates every time when he wants it. Lower interest rates may trigger inflation, which plays out well for Bitcoin in the short term. However, Trump’s overall crypto-friendly policies are already a bullish factor for Bitcoin, and bothering the Supreme Court to terminate Powell, who has been doing his work pretty well, just to cut the interest rates may not be a good move. Powell’s term ends in May 2026. Let’s just see what happens. You might also like: Bank of America says Fed should stop rate cuts —How will crypto react to Trump 2.0?

title: Reading Between the Lines of Ripple/SEC’s Joint Request to Halt Case

According to the court filing, Ripple, company executives Brad Garlinghouse and Christian Larsen, and the SEC have agreed in principle to conclude the case, pending formal approval from the Commission. However, this agreement still requires formal approval from the SEC Commission itself. title: SEC Dismisses Helium Token Lawsuit With Prejudice, Nova Labs Agrees to $200K Settlement
body: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has dismissed its lawsuit against Nova Labs, the developer of the Helium Network, which alleged that the company sold unregistered securities. Filed in January 2025, the lawsuit targeted the distribution of Helium's HNT, MOBILE, and IOT tokens, as well as the sale of hotspot devices. The dismissal, made with prejudice, confirms that these tokens and devices are not considered securities under U.S. law. This decision prevents the SEC from refiling the case. As part of the resolution, Nova Labs agreed to pay a $200,000 settlement over separate fraud claims related to its Series D equity financing. To continue reading this as well as other DeFi and Web3 news, visit us at thedefiant.io

title: Japan’s FSA introduces new framework that divides crypto into two categories
body: Japan’s FSA has released a discussion paper on crypto regulations that seeks to categorize digital assets into two distinct categories. According to a recent report by Coinpost, the country’s Financial Services Agency has asked for public feedback regarding a discussion paper titled “Verification of the state of the system related to crypto assets.” The financial watchdog will be collecting opinions on the new cryptocurrency framework introduced through the discussion paper until May 10, 2025. The paper presents a dual-approach to regulating crypto, by dividing crypto assets into two different categories based on how funds are distributed. The first category is called Type 1, which encompasses crypto assets used for business purposes or to generate funding for the parent project. These include altcoins from emerging projects that still need community funding to keep growing. While the other category, Type 2, includes crypto assets that are more decentralized or more established by nature. Type 2 cryptocurrencies include Bitcoin ( BTC ) and Ethereum ( ETH ), which do not issue tokens to raise funds for business purposes. These tokens are called “non-fundraising or non-business crypto.” Depending on which category the virtual assets fall, they are subject to a different set of crypto regulations, adjusted to suit each type’s characteristics. Japan’s FSA stated that with Type 1 crypto assets, regulators feel a strong need to push for more transparency from projects to disclose information to prospective traders about what the funds would be used for. Read more: Japan’s crypto reform bill headed to National Diet after cabinet approval Therefore, the Type 1 token issuers would need to disclose detailed information about the purpose of their funding, project details and risks associated to investing in the project among others. They will be expected to comply to regulations from the Japanese FSA, which include occasional disclosure obligations. The regulations for Type 1 crypto would come into effect once the project has garnered a large number of general investors. The FSA stated that it will also be considering whether certain Type 1 projects fall under security token regulations. On the other hand, the FSA will not be dealing directly with issuers of Type 1 crypto projects. This is because the financial agency believes it is difficult to identify a specific issuer and impose obligations on them. Thus, they will enforce regulations regarding Type 2 cryptocurrencies on exchange platforms. Under this framework, crypto exchange firms would be required to provide the FSA information on Type 2 crypto’s significant price fluctuations that impact the market. “There is a possibility that correspondence will mainly be done through exchange companies,” stated the FSA in the policy outline. According to CoinPost, the committee plans to take into account regulatory trends in other countries and public feedback before finalizing the crypto regulatory framework. As previously reported by crypto.news, the FSA declared that it would be revising the Financial Instruments and Exchange Act. The agency aims to submit the changes to parliament as early as 2026. Under the revision, cryptocurrencies will no longer be seen as payment tools, but rather as its own financial product category. title: Arizona’s Decisive Move: Senate Safeguards Crypto Mining Rights, Fuels Digital Asset Innovation
body: In a landmark victory for the digital asset industry, Arizona has emerged as a champion for crypto mining innovation. The state Senate recently passed the Bitcoin Mining Rights Bill (HB 2342), signaling a powerful stance in favor of technological advancement and economic diversification. This decisive legislative action is poised to reshape the landscape for Bitcoin mining and other digital asset operations within the state, potentially setting a precedent for other regions to follow. Why is Arizona Championing Crypto Mining? Arizona’s move to protect crypto mining operations stems from a broader understanding of the economic and technological potential of digital assets. By proactively establishing a regulatory framework that fosters innovation rather than hindering it, Arizona is positioning itself as a forward-thinking state ready to embrace the future of finance and technology. The Bitcoin Mining Rights Bill is not just about facilitating Bitcoin mining ; it’s about creating an environment where digital asset technologies can thrive, attracting investment, and generating high-tech jobs. Let’s break down the key aspects of this groundbreaking legislation: Protection from Local Bans: The core of HB 2342 lies in its provision to prevent local municipalities from imposing zoning restrictions or outright bans on individuals and businesses engaged in crypto mining or operating nodes. This ensures a consistent and predictable regulatory environment across the state. Safeguarding Individual Rights: The bill explicitly safeguards the rights of individuals to operate nodes and mine digital assets, recognizing these activities as legitimate and valuable contributions to the digital economy. Promoting Innovation: By removing the threat of localized prohibitive regulations, Arizona is sending a clear message that it welcomes innovation in the digital assets space. This can attract entrepreneurs, developers, and investors to the state. Economic Growth: Crypto mining and related industries can contribute significantly to the state’s economy through job creation, infrastructure development, and increased tax revenue. This bill is a strategic step towards harnessing this economic potential. What are the Benefits of Protecting Bitcoin Mining and Digital Assets? The Arizona Senate’s decision to advance the Bitcoin Mining Rights Bill unlocks a plethora of benefits, not just for the crypto mining industry but for the entire state and potentially the broader digital economy. Benefit Description Economic Diversification Attracting crypto mining and digital assets businesses diversifies Arizona’s economy beyond traditional sectors, making it more resilient and adaptable to future technological shifts. Job Creation The crypto mining industry and its ecosystem create high-paying jobs in technology, engineering, operations, and related fields, boosting employment opportunities for Arizonans. Technological Advancement Fostering Bitcoin mining and digital assets innovation encourages technological advancements in areas like energy efficiency, hardware development, and blockchain technology, positioning Arizona at the forefront of these fields. Increased Investment A favorable regulatory environment for crypto mining attracts significant investment from both domestic and international companies, injecting capital into the state’s economy. Energy Sector Innovation Crypto mining operations can incentivize the development and utilization of renewable energy sources and more efficient energy management solutions, driving innovation in the energy sector. Are There Any Challenges or Concerns? While the Bitcoin Mining Rights Bill is largely seen as a positive step, it’s important to acknowledge potential challenges and address concerns proactively. Energy Consumption: Crypto mining , particularly Bitcoin mining , can be energy-intensive. It’s crucial to ensure that mining operations are encouraged to adopt sustainable energy practices and explore renewable energy sources to mitigate environmental impact. Community Impact: While the bill prevents local bans, it’s important to consider the potential impact of large-scale crypto mining operations on local communities, including noise levels and infrastructure demands. Responsible mining practices and community engagement are essential. Regulatory Clarity: While HB 2342 provides clarity on local bans, ongoing dialogue and collaboration between state and local authorities, as well as the digital assets industry, are necessary to ensure comprehensive and adaptable regulations as the industry evolves. What’s Next for Arizona and Crypto Mining? With the Bitcoin Mining Rights Bill passing the Senate, it now awaits the governor’s signature to become law. If signed, Arizona will solidify its position as a leader in supporting crypto mining and digital assets . This legislation could inspire other states to adopt similar measures, creating a more unified and supportive regulatory landscape for the digital asset industry across the United States. For the Bitcoin mining and broader digital assets community, this development in Arizona is a significant win. It represents a growing recognition of the legitimacy and potential of these technologies by policymakers. It also underscores the importance of proactive engagement and education to shape favorable regulatory outcomes. Actionable Insights for Crypto Enthusiasts and Businesses Here are some actionable insights based on Arizona’s pro- crypto mining stance: Explore Opportunities in Arizona: For crypto mining businesses and individuals, Arizona is becoming an increasingly attractive location to set up operations. The clear regulatory framework and supportive environment can provide a stable foundation for growth. Advocate for Similar Legislation: The success of HB 2342 in Arizona can serve as a model for advocacy efforts in other states. Engage with your local representatives and educate them about the benefits of supporting digital assets and crypto mining . Focus on Sustainable Mining: As the industry grows, sustainability will become increasingly important. Invest in and promote energy-efficient Bitcoin mining practices and renewable energy sources to ensure the long-term viability and social acceptance of crypto mining . Stay Informed and Engaged: The regulatory landscape for digital assets is constantly evolving. Stay informed about legislative developments in your region and actively participate in shaping the future of the industry. Conclusion: Arizona Leads the Charge in Crypto Mining Protection Arizona’s passage of the Bitcoin Mining Rights Bill is more than just a state-level legislative update; it’s a powerful statement about the future of digital assets in the U.S. By proactively protecting crypto mining from local bans, Arizona is not only fostering innovation and economic growth within its borders but also setting a positive example for other states to follow. This bold move underscores the growing momentum behind the digital asset revolution and the increasing recognition of its transformative potential. To learn more about the latest crypto mining trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin institutional adoption.

title: Ethereum Price Soars 9% as Crypto Market Rebounds: What’s Next?
body: The post Ethereum Price Soars 9% as Crypto Market Rebounds: What’s Next? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Ethereum price jumped 9% in the past 24 hours, rising above $1,500 after a positive inflation report and the U.S. decision to pause tariffs. This helped shift the Crypto Fear & Greed Index from “Extreme Fear” to “Fear.” Despite the rebound, investors continue pulling out of crypto ETFs—Ethereum funds saw $11.2 million in outflows, even though ETH outperformed Bitcoin with an 8.1% gain. The overall crypto market is recovering, but institutional confidence remains shaky. Sentiment Turns Bearish as ETH Underperforms According to recent santiment data , lately, the sentiment around Ethereum has turned increasingly negative. Since December 2021, ETH has dropped over 77% in value against Bitcoin and still trades far below its all-time high in dollars. Many smaller altcoins have outperformed it, leading to frequent comparisons with low-value “shitcoins.” This consistent underperformance has left long-term holders frustrated, and even some institutional investors have started doubting Ethereum’s ability to keep pace with the rapidly changing crypto market. What Went Wrong for Ethereum? The market’s frustration with Ethereum comes down to a few key issues. While its move to faster Layer-2 networks was a smart upgrade, it ended up splitting user activity. On top of that, Ethereum’s upgrades have been slow and complicated, making it hard for regular investors to keep up, especially compared to Bitcoin’s simplicity or Solana’s speed. With unclear regulations and no strong story to tell, Ethereum now feels like it’s stuck in the middle, not leading the way in innovation and not seen as the safest bet either. Behind the Scenes, Ethereum Keeps Building Despite the criticism, Ethereum has continued to grow behind the scenes. It switched to Proof-of-Stake in 2022, cutting energy use and reducing new ETH supply. In 2023, it allowed users to withdraw staked ETH, and more upgrades are coming to make transactions on Layer-2 even cheaper. However, Ethereum still leads in DeFi and on-chain identity and gained more trust from institutions with the launch of Ethereum Futures ETFs. Liquid staking platforms like Lido and cbETH have also helped expand the ecosystem, showing that Ethereum’s foundation remains strong for the long term. Is Ethereum Setting Up for a Comeback? Ethereum is still the 2nd largest crypto, trading around $1,540 well ahead of Tether. While many people are feeling negative about it, that kind of extreme bearish mood often shows a trend reversal could be near. Ethereum might not be making big moves right now, but it’s steadily improving. With all the work being done behind the scenes, it could be one of the most underrated assets as we move into 2025.

title: Ripple SEC Case: Lawyer Reveals Crucial Date for Major XRP Lawsuit Updates
body: As the Ripple SEC case is nearing a critical juncture, legal expert Fred Rispoli reveals a crucial date for the case’s upcoming developments. As the crypto community eagerly awaits the XRP lawsuit’s settlement, the lawyer uncovers potential developments that could determine the case’s outcome. According to Fred Rispoli, the XRP lawsuit will reach a significant milestone on April 16, 2025 (Wednesday), the scheduled date for Ripple’s appellate brief. Let’s discuss the attorney’s thoughts on the possible developments and potential settlement of the Ripple case. Ripple SEC Case Update: What To Expect on April 16? In a recent X post, lawyer Fred Rispoli predicted a significant development in the Ripple SEC case, anticipating a crucial turn on April 16, when Ripple is set to file its appellate brief. As per his statement, this potential moment could shed new light on the case and possibly influence its outcome. Notably, the lawyer emphasized that there’s no possibility of an extension for Ripple’s appellate brief, making April 16 a critical deadline. Thus, Ripple is expected to take one of two actions: either file its brief as scheduled or issue a notice indicating a settlement or withdrawal from the appeal. This binary outcome has significant implications for the SEC vs Ripple case. Ripple’s Binary Choice Rispoli’s prediction presents a binary choice for Ripple next Wednesday. These options include Ripple filing its appellate brief with a 10% chance and the case’s settlement or withdrawal notice with a 90% likelihood. This stark contrast highlights the high probability of a resolution, according to the lawyer’s assessment. XRP Lawsuit Settlement Discussions Prevail Though the US SEC has reportedly dropped its appeal following which Ripple withdrew its cross-appeal , the final resolution of the case remains uncertain. This sparks multiple interpretations and widespread anxiety within the community. Previously, Fred Rispoli highlighted that the Ripple SEC case is likely to end within two months. However, a mysterious filing that popped up recently has added further ambiguity to the case’s conclusion. The post Ripple SEC Case: Lawyer Reveals Crucial Date for Major XRP Lawsuit Updates appeared first on CoinGape .
